Description: Limestone stela: rough with a rounded top, restored from two pieces. The stela bears an inscription in low relief giving the name Nefer, determined with a figure of a dwarf. The surface of the stone has been slightly pitted by weathering and the edges of the stela are chipped.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tomb of Semerkhet, subsidiary grave
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, 27, pl.XXXI, 37; pl.XXXV, 37; British Museum, 'Hieroglyphic Texts from Egyptian Stelae, etc'., I (London), pl.2; J. Capart, ‘Les Débuts de L’Art, 247, fig. 176 (top left); P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit I (Wiesbaden, 1963), 182, 540.
